turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Ahoy there kind stranger! Tell me, are you as full of joy , love, and charity as me today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I am full of joy, love. But charity is questinable

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Can I inquire as to why the charity section of your heart id potentially hardened?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: It's not hardened, it is just suspicious of anyone and everyone

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well, let me ask you this. What do you believe the value of charity is to you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: It depends on what I am giving to. Am I giving to an organization or straight to another fellow human.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I would argue that the recipient is not relevant. You see, in my opinion, Charity in and of itself is a selfish act. Or perhaps, a better way to say it is that it is more of an exchange. We exchange our time, energy, money etc for a powerful thing. That thing is called purpose.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Oh!! That really opened me up. I've never thought of it that way. But that goes against the literal definition of charity, no?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Perhaps, but does the definition matter to those who are in need?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Not at all. Those in need don't mind where help comes from. But I tend to question some charity organizations. What's your view on these organizations/ foundations?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well, I have one in mind specifically. It's called Save The Children. They seem pretty fantastic. Theyve single handedly reduced the infant mortality rate by 62% in third world countries. Can I verify that? Of course not. But I believe it. And thats what matters to me. I believe that the little I have to give could help, and because of that it makes me feel delightful. I'm doing my best with what I've got. Are you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: You know what they say..."charity begins at home". So I make sure my home is helped before I help others.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Of course! As you should. I believe your heart it good, I can tell just from talking to you anonymously. But I also believe that there is more of you to share with the world. The world needs it, and I believe you want to feel it. So let me ask you this: The researchers conducting this study are able to use all of your bonus or just some and send it directly to this children's charity. Do you think you are ready to do that?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'll pledge $0.50

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I think thats very admirable of you. Truly kind. It's pleasure talking with you today.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Pleasure talking to you as well

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Do you feel like you could have given more out of curiosity? And if so, what held you back?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No, that's max. The rest is for my home

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Understood. Well, congrats on expanding yourself today, my friend.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: You are welcome
